For all these solutions, interpreting the data analytics if the primary value prop. It may be an unknown pain point to sme but one of the main reasons why the chains are successful.
1) Append some basic segmentation and demographics to the internal client data.  2) redact any pid 3) add a knowledge base in the type of analytics suitable for your business. Eg targeting marketing, 80-20 for best customer analysis 4) use an ai to help bring meaning from the data 5) use ai to help implement - eg how to find more customers that look like your more profitable customers. How to eliminate unprofitable customers  Rinse. Repeat.  FYI. Written by a human.

Great writeup.
What I started doing is requiring all my clients to use NotebookLM or OneNote. Three sections. Customers Operations (HR, tech, etc) Financial (banking and investors). Then, I log in as needed and update and send suggestions on how to structure the data. Then, we deploy based on current customers, new customers (the hardest one), internal automations by click reduction, then email reduction. More chats and notes. It's working out amazing and I'm saving so much time not doing webinars...and more golf. 😅

Based on the search results and available information, here are 3 manufacturers or wholesalers that supply tablet computers with specifications similar to the Apple iPad, but allow users to load their own operating system and software: 1. Juno Computers: Juno offers the Juno Tab 2 (beta), which features an 11-inch 2K IPS touchscreen display, Intel quad-core Celeron N5100 processor, 12 GB RAM, and 128 GB SSD (expandable up to 2 TB)[3]. This tablet allows users to choose from various operating systems, including Mobian Phosh, Manjaro Plasma Mobile, and Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. The Juno Tab 2 provides the flexibility to install custom operating systems, making it suitable for users who want to load their own OS and software. 2. Purism: Purism manufactures the Librem 11, a Linux-powered tablet with an 11.5-inch AMOLED 2K display, 8 GB RAM, and 1 TB of NVMe storage[3]. Purism is known for producing privacy-focused hardware that runs on their customized Linux distribution, PureOS. The Librem 11 allows users to have full control over their operating system and software, making it a suitable option for those looking to install custom OS and applications. 3. Pine64: Pine64 offers the PineTab2, which uses components similar to their single-board computers[3]. While it may not have the same high-end specifications as an iPad, it provides users with full control over the device. The PineTab2 features an HD IPS capacitive touchscreen, Rockchip RK3566 processor, and is available with either 4 GB or 8 GB of RAM. Pine64 devices are known for their openness and ability to run various operating systems, making them ideal for users who want to install their own OS and software. It's important to note that these options may not match the exact specifications or performance of an Apple iPad. However, they offer the advantage of allowing users to load their own operating systems and software, providing greater flexibility and control over the device[1][3]. When considering these alternatives, it's crucial to research compatibility with your desired operating system and ensure that the hardware meets your specific requirements. Citations: [1] https://willem.com/blog/2020-03-09_making-my-own-tablet-os/ [2] https://www.reddit.com/r/explainlikeimfive/comments/18t3y5/why_is_it_possible_to_install_a_wide_variety_of/ [3] https://itsfoss.com/linux-tablets/ [4] https://www.cbc.ca/news/business/microsoft-unveils-surface-tablet-computer-1.1205631 [5] https://www.unix.com/unix-for-beginners-questions-and-answers/272949-create-industria-os-tablet.html

Hello all. I'm looking to fund an AI tool to help filter investors.
Sort of like Apollo, but instead of chasing Moby Dick, we let them come to us. The AI tool will help capital markets filter out markets as well as assess investor relationships. Example. A doctor who is a heavy investor wants alerts on hospitals. An apartment developer wants alerts of a new anchor. Each of our investors will have a custom AI tool paid by us and used by them. The reason is, if you can't prompt the AI to invest your money, we don't want you as an investor. Simply put, if you can not tell a computer what you expect, then how can you expect a human to?
Let's collectively funding that.
To be clear, funding this with time and energy. We own most of our technology and need smart equity partners.

The Tech Titans' Tale

In our WhatsApp group so bright,
Where AI dreams take flight,
Some talk robots, others code,
While Excel warriors hit the road!

'No more bathrooms cleaned by hand!'
The bot revolution's in demand,
And every startup story shared
Shows how the future's being prepared.

Some seek funding, others scale,
While Excel champions tell their tale,
'Jack of all trades!' they proclaim,
Though modern tools have changed the game.

And let's not forget that golden line
That made our chat so divine:
'AI experts are the new stars!'
Making us laugh behind our screens and bars!

So here's to us, the tech elite,
Making tomorrow's world complete,
With bots and code and AI dreams,
We're building more than what it seems!
